üöÄ Fueling India‚Äôs Innovation Engine at Viksit Bharat@2047 | Bengaluru

At the ViksitBharat@2047 Investor Roundtable Conference, Shri Sumeet Jarangal, Director, DPIIT, presented the vision of Startup India ‚Äî reinforcing the government's commitment to empowering startups as key drivers of India's economic transformation. üáÆüá≥üíº

üìå Key Highlights:

üîπ Showcased how DPIIT-led initiatives are simplifying regulations, expanding funding access, and building an inclusive innovation ecosystem.

üîπ Spotlighted major schemes:
‚Ä¢ Fund of Funds for Startups (FoF)
‚Ä¢ Startup India Seed Fund Scheme (SISFS)
‚Ä¢ Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups (CGSS)
‚Ä¢ Section 80-IAC income tax exemption for innovative startups

üîπ Called on state governments to share feedback on evolving policy needs, including the proposed update to the startup definition.

üîπ Encouraged startups and incubators to actively tap into available support and contribute to India‚Äôs industrial and technological leap. üí°üåç

üîó The message was clear ‚Äî India‚Äôs growth journey is powered by its startups.

Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade
National Industrial Corridor Development Corporation (NICDC)

Shri Amardeep Singh Bhatia | Shri Sanjiv | Shri Sumeet Jarangal
Smt. Gunjan Krishna | Shri Dr. S. Selvakumar 
Mamatha Venkatesh Aditya Dimri 

#StartupIndia #ViksitBharat2047 #DPIIT #Innovation #Startups #MakeInIndia #InvestIndia #Bangalore #IndustrialGrowth #DigitalIndia #EaseOfDoingBusiness

üìçIn Shillong, Meghalaya today, Shri Md Alam Ansari, Deputy Director, DPIIT, and Ms Pratiti S. from Startup India, participated in the Roundtable Interaction on the revision of the Meghalaya Startup Policy. 

Meghalaya has spearheaded regional entrepreneurial development in the northeast of India. Shri Md Ansari addressed key challenges and bottlenecks that the new proposed policy can explore, including innovation opportunities in the manufacturing sector, as India moves from a service led to a product led economy.

The discussion also highlighted the need to enhance the role of key ecosystem stakeholders ‚Äî including incubators, accelerators, and mentorship networks ‚Äî in driving innovation and entrepreneurship across India. üöÄ

Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade

Shri Sanjiv | Shri Sumeet Jarangal
Mamatha Venkatesh | Shivangi Jain | Pratiti S.
Anmol Agarwal | Ritwik Malhotra
PRIME Meghalaya- A Government of Meghalaya initiative

#Meghalaya #Startups #Entrepreneurship

Startup India, DPIIT has signed an MoU with the Indian Venture and Alternate Capital Association (IVCA) to strengthen capital access and governance for startups across India.

As part of this collaboration, IVCA will:
üí∏ Facilitate funding access through curated investor connects, pitching sessions, and thematic roundtables
ü§ù Provide mentorship and strategic guidance from leading VC/PE fund managers and domain experts
üìà Support capacity building through governance masterclasses.

This MoU will help build a more inclusive, well-governed, and capital-ready startup ecosystem across sectors and stages.

Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade

Shri Narendra Modi | Shri Piyush Goyal

IKP Knowledge Park is proud to share that Dr. Vithal K Lakkineni, Ph.D. from the Technology Transfer Office at IKP PRIME was invited to speak at the AICTE Faculty Development Program on Innovation and Entrepreneurship held at Vignan's University (Deemed to be), Guntur, on 25th July 2025. 

Huge congratulations to Sandeep Satheesan CEO - Technology Business Incubator- Vignan, Vigan team Abdul R, Vijaya Ramu Dirisala, Dean,¬†Pavan Kumar Kakumanu and Dr. Krishna Harshitha, Dr Kiranmayi Chanduri.
 
The knowledge-sharing session brought together a dynamic group of professors from MBA and BBA institutions. The workshop saw enthusiastic participation and insightful discussions around the innovation ecosystem, the evolving role of educational institutions in nurturing young entrepreneurs, and how faculty members can become effective startup mentors.

The workshop emphasised how faculty in Tier-2 cities can mentor startups from ideation to market. A key focus was on grassroots innovations in AgriTech, nutraceuticals, and food technologies, aligning institutional efforts with community needs. Participants were encouraged to build local innovation ecosystems and foster collaborations with government agencies. 

This workshop reinforced IKP PRIME's commitment to building inclusive innovation ecosystems and strengthened the connection between education, entrepreneurship, and impactful innovation.

Deepanwita Chattopadhyay Bindu Nishal Viswanadham Duppatla Dr. Priyankana Mukherjee Apoorva Bhatnagar Sridhar Ramanathan IKP EDEN Aaqib Jameel Dedeepya Chermala Vishaka Sawan Ranajit Sen Anuradha Barua Sudha Kalyani Bommareddy, Ph.D. Rohika B Rajeswari Sepana Shreyas Kudva

India is entering a new era of biomedical research, and the i3 Summit ‚Äì ‡§µ‡§ø‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂, hosted by Blockchain for Impact (BFI), marked a powerful step forward.

Bringing together leaders from science, industry, and government, the summit spotlighted how collaboration can accelerate translational research and drive healthcare innovation for all.

IKP was proud to be part of this important conversation shaping the future of biomedical innovation in India.

Deepanwita Chattopadhyay, was invited as a panellist to contribute to the panel "Indian Healthcare Innovation & Its Translation ‚Äì Crossing Chasms & Bridging Gaps", sharing key insights on speeding the journey from research to real-world impact. She was joined by Dr. Sridhar Ramanathan, Dr. Viswanadham Duppatla, and Aaqib Jameel.

With initiatives like the BFI-BIOME Network gaining momentum, we look forward to contributing to a resilient, inclusive, and innovation-driven healthcare ecosystem for India and beyond.

Through DIY gap discovery, expert mentorship, a peer community, and access to essential business tools and strategies for sustainable scaling, this program puts founders in the driver‚Äôs seat of their startup journey.

A proud moment for the E- YUVA Center GIET University-YUVA Centre at GIET University as the student-developed Nature Bloom Biopesticide project receives a patent from the Government of India highlighting meaningful progress in sustainable agriculture through the Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) supported program.

On #NationalScienceDay2025, CCAMP is excited to share some of its work that demonstrates the power of science to solve societal problems 

We are proud to be fostering several next gen deep-science based innovative solutions and research that are bridging critical gaps in healthcare, agriculture and environment

Some of these include
üß™Mitigating antimicrobial resistance, strengthening maternal and child health, treating degenerative illnesses and cancer, and developing diagnostics for infectious diseases,
üß™Replacing chemical pesticides with biologicals, boosting crop productivity and farmer incomes, and increasing food security
 üß™Capturing carbon and adopting climate resilient solutions

And, much more!

IIT Mandi Catalyst organized a curated workshop focused on 'Funding Schemes for Startups.' The workshop, skillfully led by Mr. Gaurav P., Associate General Manager at IIT Mandi Catalyst, aimed to empower founders by introducing the funding opportunities provided by IIT Mandi Catalyst.

The session emphasized seed investments, grants, and eligibility criteria tailored to different business phases. Discussions focused on aligning funding needs with growth stages, crafting persuasive proposals, and understanding investor expectations. Gaurav Parulkar's expertise provided startups with actionable insights, highlighting strategic approaches to leverage financial resources effectively for sustainable growth.

üì¢ ¬†IIT Mandi Catalyst is pleased to invite applications for the Investment Readiness Program.

Join our Investment Readiness Program, a dynamic initiative designed for startups poised for commercialization and ready to secure investments for expansion. This program serves as a vital bridge between startups and the market, offering invaluable support and guidance to accelerate growth.

Program Highlights:
üîπ Craft a compelling pitch tailored for investors.
üîπ Benefit from personalized mentorship by industry experts.
üîπ Validate the financial viability and growth strategy of your venture.
üîπ Showcase your startup to potential investors on Demo Day.
üîπ Refine your pitch with feedback from seasoned professionals.

Demo Day:
Cap off your 90-day sprint with Demo Day, where cohort startups gain exclusive access to a curated audience of venture capitalists, angel investors, and grant providers. This is your chance to shine as you pitch your venture to influential stakeholders, paving the way for potential investments and strategic partnerships.

Don't miss this opportunity to propel your startup to new heights. Join our Investment Readiness Program and unlock the resources and connections you need to thrive in the competitive market landscape.

üìÖ Last date to apply: August 7th, 2025

üëâ To apply for the program, click on the following link: https://lnkd.in/gDYCbEeE

üì¢ Bharat Pitchathon 4.0 - Opportunity to pitch to Top Investors of the country, is coming to your state üöÄ

Thrilled to announce that the highly anticipated third edition of India's Premier Series of Pitch Event, Bharat Pitchathon 4.0, is coming to 20+ States.

We, at the IIT Mandi Catalyst are delighted to partner as the Incubation Partner for Bharat Pitchathon 4.0.

Bharat Pitchathon 3.0 was a journey like no other with over 200 startup pitches, 600 investor-startup connections, 6-month growth¬† program and the invaluable support of 220+ partners including incubator & investment partners. 

Registration link - https://lnkd.in/gFhNupCv

What's in store for you at Bharat Pitchathon 4.0?
üîπ Pitch to Top Investors: Present your ideas to top investors for potential partnerships and funding.
üîπ Expert Connection: Gain insights and guidance from industry experts.
üîπ Resource Riches: Gain access to a treasure trove of mentorship, networking, and growth opportunities.
üîπ High-Impact Visibility: Elevate your startup's reach and visibility.
üîπ Thrilling growth program: Selected startups receive comprehensive support including mentorship, GTM support with opportunities to pitch to prominent investors on a national scale.

But that's not all! 

üîπ Top 50 startups will be a part of an accelerator cohort for deep dive learning and growth opportunities.

Registration link - https://lnkd.in/gFhNupCv

Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to shine and make your mark in the startup world.

A big shoutout to Saravanan S for delivering an impactful session on Customer Segmentation for Scale at the DERBI Foundation üëè

Your deep experience in building startup ecosystems, helping raise üí∞ $100M+ in funding, and supporting üå± 100+ early-stage ventures truly inspired our founders. Dr.Premachandra Sagar | Rohan Prem Sagar | Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma | Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) | MeitY Startup Hub | Startup India | IT BT Department, Karnataka | Dayananda Sagar University | Dayananda Sagar Institutions | Dayananda Sagar College of Engineering, BANGALORE

üåç Thank You, Tony Loaiza! ‚ú®

We were honored to host Tony Loaiza, Silicon Valley-based CEO and seasoned entrepreneur, for an inspiring and eye-opening workshop on Startup Culture & Best Practices, with a special focus on the U.S. innovation and networking ecosystem.

Tony shared his wealth of experience around:
 üîπ Emerging tech trends in the global market
 üîπ Strategic networking and positioning in the USA
 üîπ Revenue growth frameworks, including the innovative Revenue as a Service (RaaS) model
 üîπ Practical lessons from building and exiting multiple companies

The session gave our founders a rare insider‚Äôs view into the mindset, agility, and strategy that define globally successful startups, and how Indian entrepreneurs can adapt these best practices to scale internationally.

Thank you, Tony, for generously sharing your journey and empowering our startup community to think global and act bold! üåêüöÄ

Is Your Startup at a Crossroads? It‚Äôs Time to ReSTARTup!
¬†
Have you been struggling in your entrepreneurship journey¬†due to challenges in scale, operations, or market fit ?
¬†
Don‚Äôt give up yet - the journey isn‚Äôt over.
It‚Äôs time to Pivot, Rebuild & Relaunch !
¬†
ReStartup is a powerful intervention by FITT ‚Äì IIT Delhi that connects struggling but high-potential startups with seasoned mentors, including unicorn founders and Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi alumni.
¬†
What‚Äôs in it for you?

-¬†1-on-1 strategic mentoring with top startup minds
-¬†Action-based growth plans for your startup
-¬†Chance to build long-term advisory/board relationships
-¬†Visibility through IIT Delhi‚Äôs innovation ecosystem
-¬†Opportunity to join the FITT ‚Äì IIT Delhi incubation portfolio
¬†
We‚Äôre selecting only a few startups via a nationwide call for applications.
Each selected startup founder will get a 30-minute one-on-one mentoring session with Seasoned Mentors from IIT Delhi Alumni & Unicorn Network to help them pivot or restart stronger than ever.
¬†
Apply by 10th August : https://lnkd.in/gFcm8SMS

From Flipkart to Fractal, Zomato to Zerodha ‚Äî IITians are shaping India‚Äôs startup revolution, one unicorn at a time!
This dynamic infographic by Inc42 showcases how alumni from¬†IIT Delhi¬†and¬†IIT Bombay¬†are powering India's most iconic startups. Whether it's BharatPe, Groww, Delhivery, Razorpay, or Gupshup ‚Äì the unicorn universe is brimming with IIT brilliance!
IIT Delhi¬†founders include visionaries behind:
Zomato, Meesho, 1MG, Blinkit, BharatPe, upGrad, Oxyzo, Pine Labs, Spinny, and more
IIT Bombay¬†alumni are the minds behind:
CoinDCX, Groww, Gupshup, Delhivery, Mindtickle, Upstox, CARS24, BillDesk, Flipkart, and many others
Regardless of the scoreboard,¬†India wins¬†as our IIT alumni continue to build, disrupt, and inspire globally.
At PanIIT Alumni India, we take immense pride in celebrating these changemakers who are not just creating wealth but building a bold new India.

Foundation for Innovation and Technology Transfer, IIT Delhi, was a part of the¬†@i3 Summit ‚ÄúVimarsh‚Äù, organized by Blockchain for Impact (BFI), spotlighting cutting-edge innovations in healthcare and biomedical technologies.

Shri. Nitin Gadkari shared inspiring insights on India‚Äôs growing leadership in MedTech and healthcare..

Dr Nikhil Agarwal (MD, FITT) joined panel on ‚ÄúThe Emerging AI Future & Its Impact on Healthcare in India,‚Äù highlighting India‚Äôs strengths as a testbed for AI.

Our team Dr Nikhil Agarwal, Ashutosh Pastor, Prachi B. formalized FITT‚Äôs collaboration with BFI through MoU exchange, reaffirming our commitment to innovation and impact.

A key moment was Vayuguard, one of our incubated startups, presenting its air purification system to a guest speaker.

Kavisha Singh, and Shreya Singh represented FITT at the booth, showcasing startups CLUIX Pvt Ltd, Fruvetech, PeaceinPaces, @Bharat Helix, @Flowmatrix, @BalmanEswaranBiomedicine, NanoSafe, Ayukriyam Innovations Pvt Ltd, Indigotex Pvt. Ltd.,  Incipient Materials Private Limited.

https://www.linkedin.com/company/social-.text:
Impact and Sustainability are among the most exploited words in the development world. But the essence is simple:

Go back to the roots. 

Prioritise soil health, and productivity will naturally follow. Design farm equipment with farmers, for farmers‚Äîjust like the village blacksmith who used to built with deep understanding and care. Build market linkages that serve their interest, not digital intermediaries. And most importantly, treat farmers as bankable entrepreneurs, not beneficiaries of charity. Real impact is not about disruption. It‚Äôs about trust, dignity, and lasting systems.

The smiles in this picture reflect the joy of reduced drudgery for women farmers. For them, this is impact: the simple dignity of easier work, saved time, and a little less burden on their shoulders.

Cut the Fat, Not the Flow

The development sector is drowning in intermediaries‚Äîre-granting agencies, consultants, collectives, and collaboratives.....Too often, they justify their existence with buzzwords like ‚Äúsystems change,‚Äù ‚Äúcapacity building,‚Äù ‚Äúecosystem,‚Äù and ‚Äúplatforms,‚Äù while delivering little beyond roundtables with the same faces in new venues, glossy reports where fonts change more than the data, flashy websites, feel-good videos (about themselves), feel-sad videos (about communities), and databases no one trusts.

The problem isn‚Äôt intermediation‚Äîit‚Äôs bad intermediation. When done well, intermediaries can aggregate demand, align incentives, allocate capital efficiently, and manage risk. But when they morph into self-reinforcing bureaucracies, they stall progress and drain resources, especially when led by people with no personal stake in the outcome. Low "skin in the game" means leaders enjoy asymmetric rewards without bearing consequences. They are insulated from failure, making them risk-averse and impact-light.

We need to rethink the chain. Funders must back proximate actors directly, invest in real capacity, and shift accountability from process to outcomes. The goal isn‚Äôt fewer intermediaries‚Äîit‚Äôs better ones. The best ones are entrepreneurs. They put their credibility, sweat, and future on the line.
Communities don‚Äôt need more gatekeepers. They need partners who deliver.

Ready to redefine your startup's growth? Unlock a world of opportunities in India's emerging tech hub with Bridge2Bharat-Hubballi!

Gain access to extensive infrastructure, a skilled talent pool, C-suite mentorship, and exclusive VC connects. We're here to help you redefine success in one of India's most dynamic emerging hubs.

Ready to scale your startup? 

Fill out our form to get started, 
Form: https://lnkd.in/gbJWxdCR
To know more, visit: https://lnkd.in/grttaiye

Desh Deshpande | Raju Reddy | Phanindra Sama Bharat Singh | Rachit Parekh | Ramanathan (Ram) Narayanan |  Manish Jaiswal 
Sahiti Meduri | Yash Mittal | Rashmi Joshi | Soumya Chaugala | Chetan Madivalar |  Neelappa | Varadh Kulkarni 

#Bridge2Bharat #DeshpandeStartups  #StartupEcosystem #Growth #Entrepreneurship

2 Founders. 2 Experts. One Topic = 2+2 Model!

At Deshpande Startups, we‚Äôre rethinking how meaningful founder conversations should happen. Most traditional formats‚Äîsuch as panels or one-on-ones‚Äîtend to fall short. They're either too surface-level or disconnected from the realities of building in Bharat.

That‚Äôs why we introduced the 2+2 model:
¬†‚Ä¢ 2 early-stage founders
¬†‚Ä¢ 2 seasoned experts
One open, unscripted conversation‚Äîwhere ideas collide, perspectives challenge, and learning flows both ways.

We put this model into action with our first session on ‚ÄúEnabling Founders Beyond Metros ‚Äì The ONDC Opportunity,‚Äù Moderated by¬†Rashmi Joshi

As ONDC opens new pathways for inclusive digital commerce, we explored what it truly takes to enable founders building from beyond Tier 1 cities.

Experts:¬†Nandita Sharma¬†&¬†Sachin Korla
Founders:¬†Basanth Verma¬†¬†&¬†Manjunath Gogi

What it unlocks:
This initiative builds trust by fostering safe, direct conversations without posturing. It brings together experts from diverse fields like policy, design, and commerce to tackle challenges beyond a single product. This curation of different perspectives challenges assumptions, revealing that issues often stem from cultural or trust barriers rather than tech problems.

Big thanks to all four speakers and special appreciation to Nandita Sharma for her ONDC-wide insights that brought structure and momentum.

More 2+2 sessions coming soon!

Rashmi Joshi | Manish Jaiswal

Join our panel discussion to learn how to build impactful ventures with fewer resources!

Vikas Sunkad (Founder, SunJosho Ventures)

Whether you're a founder, student, innovator, or just curious about startup life in smaller cities ‚Äì this session is for you..

Register by August 2nd.

Venue: Auditorium, Deshpande Startups
Mode: Physical

Venture Center is an award winning, leading incubator for deeptech, knowledge intensive startups, and our ùó•ùó≤ùòÄùó∂ùó±ùó≤ùóªùòÅ ùóúùóªùó∞ùòÇùóØùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùó£ùóøùóºùó¥ùóøùóÆùó∫ for startups offers a range of benefits‚Äîwithout taking any equity!

1. World-Class Infrastructure

Access to state-of-the-art labs, fully equipped offices, and flexible desks. Our facilities are designed to meet the diverse needs of startups, providing everything you need to innovate and grow.

2. Expert Mentorship and Guidance

24/7 access to in-house expertise, in addition to customized one-on-one mentoring from industry veterans. 

3. Funding Opportunities

Access to seed funds, CSR funds, and government grants for different stages of your journey.

4. Prime Location

We are based in Pune, a city known for its thriving tech and innovation scene, and we are in close proximity to prestigious educational institutions and research centers. 

5. Comprehensive Ecosystem

Our extensive support network includes legal assistance, business development resources, regulatory and IP support, and access to workshops and events that provide valuable insights and networking opportunities. 

6. Vibrant peer group community on our campus

Surround yourself with like-minded innovators and entrepreneurs who can inspire and support your startup journey.

How does one capture the attention of ten young minds aged 9 to 15 on a Saturday morning? 

...
....
.....

By challenging them to build furniture that appears to hover in mid-air  not by magic, just science!  

That is exactly what happened at the recent Floating Table Workshop by Protoshop and co-organized by the Venture Center Library. This engaging event introduced students to the fascinating world of tensegrity structures and digital fabrication through a hands-on, exploratory experience.

Thanks to all the young engineers who joined us, and kudos to the team at protoshop for such a wonderful workshop! 

Read more: https://lnkd.in/gvraY-de

50+ innovators spent their Saturday joining us for an AI deep-dive. The venue? A buzzing classroom at the School of Arts and Sciences, Ahmedabad University. The mission? Master everything from LLMs to building working AI agents.

The journey:
Morning: Demystifying how large language models actually work
Midday: Lunch from Chef Rahul Bhale
Afternoon: Building AI agents using n8n (freshly minted batch of coders!)

What made it special: 
‚úì Hands-on learning, not just theory 
‚úì Zero technical background needed 
‚úì Everyone left with new AI skills

Huge thanks to Jash Rathod for facilitation and every single participant who showed the dedication to invest a full Saturday in upskilling.

The best part? This is just the beginning.

We're committed to making cutting-edge tech accessible to our community through regular workshops like these.

Want to join our next session? Follow VentureStudio to be the first to know about upcoming workshops.

#GenerativeAI #AIWorkshop #VentureStudio #Innovation #AIEducation #Upskilling

Welcome home, Ahmedabad University Class of 2029!

Yesterday, our Vice Chancellor, Professor Pankaj Chandra, reminded parents and students why interdisciplinary learning is the foundation of our future. 

When engineering meets humanities. When business embraces biotechnology. When art inspires science. That's where innovation lives.

Students, get ready to think beyond textbooks and dream beyond disciplines.

The future is yours to shape!

Building a Safer Workplace at iCreate! 

At iCreate, safety is a priority we never compromise on. Our Admin team, led by Cdr Parimal Verma ‚Äì Head Administration and Ms sharwari Dalvi ‚Äì Supervisor - Facilities, recently organized a Fire Fighting and Safety Training session for all employees. We took a professional approach to safety by partnering with the experts at VISWAMBI SECURITY AGENCY PRIVATE LIMITED, an experienced security agency. Their expert trainers delivered a comprehensive session focusing on practical fire safety measures, emergency response protocols, and the correct use of firefighting equipment‚Äîensuring every team member is well-prepared for unforeseen situations.

#iCreateWithYou #WorkplaceSafety #FireSafety #EmployeeWellbeing #SafetyFirst #TeamiCreate

They conducted an insightful session on the HPCL Udgam Initiative, HPCL‚Äôs flagship program that supports early-stage startups with funding up to ‚Çπ2.5 Cr, mentorship, and access to HPCL‚Äôs industry expertise and networks in energy, sustainability, and allied tech domains. Applications for HP Udgam Cohort 2025 are now open for DPIIT-recognised startups across these sectors.

Their session opened new doors for our cohort, reinforcing the power of industry‚Äìstartup partnerships in accelerating innovation for energy transition and related sectors.

ü§ù Joining Hands to Accelerate Clean Energy Innovation ‚ö°üå±

We‚Äôre excited to announce that iCreate has partnered with BRK Startupbootcamp India Pvt. Ltd. to strengthen the entrepreneurial ecosystem with a sharp focus on Energy Transition and Clean Energy Innovation.

The partnership was announced during the ProtoQuik Launchpad Demo Day, marking the signing of a Letter of Collaboration between Mr. Avinash Punekar (CEO, iCreate) and Mr. Kamal Bansal (Co-Founder & CEO, BRK Startupbootcamp India Pvt. Ltd.), paving the way for startups to access mentorship, global networks, strategic investments, and best practices to scale faster and create real-world impact.
